seo.title: Transition & relocation coaching
seo.description: ICF-aligned coaching for people settling into the UK while holding commitments across borders.

hero.title: Anchor yourself while building life across borders.
hero.summary: Sessions stay calm and bilingual as needed, so you can process change, agreements, and belonging at a humane pace.

isForYou.title: Is this for you?
items: You recently moved to the UK and juggle responsibilities in another country.
You want to honour family expectations while carving out your own rhythms.
You feel both excited and disoriented by new systems, visas, or paperwork.
You are building community from scratch and want to do it without burning out.

explore.title: What we explore together
items: How do you want to describe “home” while loyalties span multiple places?
What support agreements—financial, emotional, practical—need updating?
Where might you grant yourself permission to grieve or celebrate?
What language helps you advocate for your needs in workplaces or services?
What experiments could help you meet people and rest, not just hustle?
Which values will guide choices when plans shift or paperwork delays happen?

format.title: Format & flow
bullets: Recommend six 60-minute sessions across three to four months, with flexibility to slow down when life events happen.
Language can switch between English and Mandarin (or remain in one) whenever nuance matters.
Each session ends with client-led next steps; we review alignment every two sessions.
We close by reflecting on learning, naming ongoing supports, and agreeing on future touchpoints if needed.

items.context: A policy professional relocating from Hong Kong wanted to stay connected with family while adjusting to UK workplace dynamics.
items.approach: We mapped obligations, practised scripts for setting boundaries in both Cantonese and English, and designed community-building experiments that respected introversion.
items.outcome: They reported feeling steadier, with agreements that honoured family care and clearer requests at work.

not.title: What this is not
items: Not immigration, legal, or tax advice. We can help you plan questions for specialists, not replace them.
Not emergency relocation support or crisis response.
Not a promise that culture shock disappears—we work with the feelings and choices that are yours to make.

cta.body: If this sounds close to your reality, you’re welcome to book a 20-minute intro chat.
